The impact of officer tenure on injury outcomes in law enforcement encounters
item.description:
Authors: Lomenzo et al.
Journal: The Police Journal: Theory, Practice and Principles

Police use-of-force encounters, though rare, pose serious injury risks. This study examines whether officer tenure predicts injury outcomes for both officers and suspects during use-of-force incidents. Using logistic regression on 762 Miami-Dade cases (2002–2006), this study finds that officer tenure was not linked to officer injury but negatively predicted suspect injury.
